name: M42/M43
description: The famous Orion Nebula is one of the brightest nebulae in the sky, readily visible to the naked eye as a 'fuzzy star' in Orion's sword. It is spectacular in conventional full spectrum images, but is so bright that it also reveals interesting structure in multiple isolated wavelengths. This image presents different combinations of light emitted by hydrogen, oxygen, and sulfur. Use the 'star' icons on the left to see each channel in isolation.
